---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [86c869b766](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14659/commits/86c869b766596fd9309f1613e28e106b7f16f873)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ Polynomial.isCoprime_iff_aeval_ne_zero_of_isAlgClosed`
`+ aeval_ne_zero_of_isCoprime`
`+ isCoprime_iff_aeval_ne_zero`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

Note that `Polynomial.isCoprime_iff_aeval_ne_zero` and `Polynomial.isCoprime_iff_aeval_ne_zero_of_isAlgClosed` are essentially saying the same thing: two polynomials are coprime iff they have no common roots in any algebraic extension. Note also that the typeclasses `[CommRing A] [IsDomain A] [Algebra K A]` in the former can be replaced with the weaker assumptions `[Nontrivial A] [Semiring A] [Algebra F A]`, but the stronger assumption might be more usable. They should all be equivalent, but for some reason I wasn't able to prove one from the other directly, so any help is very much appreciated.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9975921658/job/27566858967)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9975921658/job/27566859565)
Stating this (and the other lemmas) with an `Or` feels more reasonable to me; not-least because this spelling isn't simp-normal.
I'll change to that, but will keep the naming. Note that this just adds a layer of `not_and_or` everywhere.
What about a name that allows dot notation?
Do you think `IsCoprime.aeval_ne_zero` is better than `Polynomial.aeval_ne_zero_of_isCoprime`?
Mmm, you're right, we also want `Polynomial`. Let's keep as it is then.
Can you generalize this without assuming `K` to be algebraically closed but taking `a` in an algebraic closure? (We can also keep this version of course)

You mean something like this?
```
lemma Polynomial.isCoprime_iff_aeval_ne_zero_of_isAlgClosure (K : Type v) [Field K]
    [Algebra k K] [IsAlgClosure k K] (p q : k[X]) :
    IsCoprime p q   a : K, aeval a p  0  aeval a q  0 :=
  @Polynomial.isCoprime_iff_aeval_ne_zero_of_isAlgClosed _ _ _ _ (IsAlgClosure.alg_closed k) _ _ _
```
That seems to be a specialisation rather than a generalisation?

Unless you mean the fixed `AlgebraicClosure`?
How are you avoiding that coprimality is preserved by field extensions?

I'm not quite sure what you mean. We also have `Polynomial.isCoprime_iff_aeval_ne_zero` which is the version that only talks about field extensions, but I don't know how to make the proof work for algebraic closures. Ideally I want to have some result like this:
```
example (P :  {A : Type v} [Semiring A] [Algebra k A], A  Prop) (x : k) :
    ( { : Type v} [Field ] [Algebra k ] [IsAlgClosure k ], P (algebraMap k  x)) 
      ( {K : Type v} [CommRing K] [IsDomain K] [Algebra k K], P (algebraMap k K x)) := by
  sorry
```
(for some appropriate `P` e.g. `aeval` is non-zero)
I am sorry, you're lemma already says what I wanted.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(FieldTheory/*): prove coprimality of polynomials in terms of roots
